Questions.Question: What is the name of the family in 'The Simpsons'?
Questions.Explanation: The Simpsons family consists of Homer, Marge, Bart, Lisa, and Maggie Simpson.

Questions.Question: In 'Rick and Morty,' what dimension is Rick from?
Questions.Explanation: C-137 is the dimension where most of the main series takes place.

Questions.Question: Who is the creator of 'Adventure Time'?
Questions.Explanation: Pendleton Ward developed the show and serves as an executive producer and story writer.

Questions.Question: Which character from 'Futurama' has an alcohol addiction?
Questions.Explanation: Bender is powered by alcohol and always seeks alcohol to function properly.

Questions.Question: In 'Bojack Horseman,' what animal is Bojack?
Questions.Explanation: Bojack is an anthropomorphic horse who starred in the 1990s sitcom 'Horsin' Around.'

Questions.Question: What is the primary setting of 'Bob's Burgers'?
Questions.Explanation: The series centers on the Belcher family who owns a hamburger restaurant.

Questions.Question: Which animated series features a character named Sterling Archer?
Questions.Explanation: Archer is an American adult animated sitcom revolving around the mishaps of intelligence agents.

Questions.Question: What is the name of the human living in The Land of Ooo in 'Adventure Time'?
Questions.Explanation: Finn, a human boy with a heroic heart, is one of the main characters in the show.

Questions.Question: Which animated series features a character named Tina Belcher?
Questions.Explanation: Tina Belcher is the awkward and slightly strange eldest child of the Belcher family.

Questions.Question: In 'The Boondocks,' what is the last name of Huey and Riley?
Questions.Explanation: The show follows the lives of two young African American brothers, Huey and Riley Freeman.

Questions.Question: Which animated series features a character named Lisa Simpson?
Questions.Explanation: Lisa is the intelligent and kind-hearted daughter of the Simpson family in the animated series.

Questions.Question: In 'Rick and Morty,' what species is Morty's pet Jerry?
Questions.Explanation: Jerry is a small, green, caterpillar-like species that Morty adopts in the series.

Questions.Question: Which animated series features a character named Linda Belcher?
Questions.Explanation: Linda is the warm, nurturing, and upbeat wife of Bob Belcher in the show.

Questions.Question: Name the robotic character in 'Futurama' who works as a bending unit.
Questions.Explanation: Bender, often referred to as Bender Bending Rodriguez, is a central character on 'Futurama.'

Questions.Question: In 'Bojack Horseman,' what is Diane Nguyen's profession?
Questions.Explanation: Diane is a Vietnamese-American ghostwriter from Boston who becomes well-known for her writing skills.

Questions.Question: Which animated series features a character named Sterling Mallory Archer?
Questions.Explanation: Sterling Archer is a suave, self-centered spy in the animated series 'Archer.'

Questions.Question: In 'Rick and Morty,' what is Rick Sanchez's favorite catchphrase?
FalseAnswer: And that's the way the news goes.
I'm Mr. Meeseeks, look at me!
Questions.Explanation: The phrase was originally a joke, but it was later given a darker context in the series.

Questions.Question: Which animated series features a character named Sterling Malory Archer?
Questions.Explanation: Sterling Malory Archer is the main character and world's most dangerous spy in 'Archer.'

Questions.Question: In 'Bojack Horseman,' which animal is Todd Chavez?
Questions.Explanation: Todd is Bojack's best friend and a lovable, goofy human character in the series.

Questions.Question: What is the name of the caf√© where Archer and his colleagues work in 'Archer'?
Questions.Explanation: ISIS is the name of the spy agency where the main characters work in the earlier seasons.
